title: Dosing Calculator
subtitle: Calculate how much to dose to correct your water parameters

result.noCorrection: No correction needed — current value is at or above target.

safety.splitDoses: Consider splitting into {{count}} doses over 2–3 days to avoid stressing your tank inhabitants.

info.title: How this works
info.description: This calculator computes how much compound to add to bring a parameter from its current value to your target. Corals and other organisms consume these elements continuously, so regular testing and correction is expected.
info.balancing: You are balancing — not scheduling daily doses.

soda_ash.name: Soda Ash
soda_ash.description: Raises alkalinity. Preferred for reef tanks — also slightly raises pH.

baking_soda.name: Baking Soda
baking_soda.description: Raises alkalinity. Gentler pH impact than soda ash. Common and inexpensive.

calcium_chloride.name: Calcium Chloride (dihydrate)
calcium_chloride.description: Most common calcium supplement for reef tanks.

magnesium_chloride.name: Magnesium Chloride (hexahydrate)
magnesium_chloride.description: Raises magnesium. Often used alongside magnesium sulfate.

calcium_sulfate.name: Calcium Sulfate (gypsum)
calcium_sulfate.description: Raises general hardness (GH) in freshwater tanks.
